nodeps.description: Only merge packages but not their dependencies (--nodeps)

getbinpkg.description: Prefer packages specified at PORTAGE_BINHOST in make.conf

onlydeps.description: Only merge packages' dependencies but not the packages (--onlydeps)

newuse.description: Include installed packages where USE flags have changed (--newuse)

package.description: Package atom or set, e.g. C(sys-apps/foo) or C(>foo-2.13) or C(@world)

oneshot.description: Do not add the packages to the world file (--oneshot)

update.description: Update packages to the best version available (--update)

deep.description: Consider the entire dependency tree of packages (--deep)

sync.description: Sync package repositories first If yes, perform "emerge --sync" If web, perform "emerge-webrsync"

changed_use.description: Include installed packages where USE flags have changed, except when flags that the user has not enabled are added or removed (--changed-use)

keepgoing.description: Continue as much as possible after an error.

loadavg.description: Specifies that no new builds should be started if there are other builds running and the load average is at least LOAD

usepkgonly.description: Merge only binaries (no compiling). This sets getbinpkg=yes.

depclean.description: Remove packages not needed by explicitly merged packages (--depclean) If no package is specified, clean up the world's dependencies Otherwise, --depclean serves as a dependency aware version of --unmerge

jobs.description: Specifies the number of packages to build simultaneously.
